cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward, paralleling the Mid-Atlantic coast and heading toward Atlantic Canada
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Outer Banks of North Carolina (brush/close-approach near Cape Hatteras)
cyclone._comment: landfall/closest approach imminent at time of advisory
center already well NE of Port of Charleston, SC

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch only north of Port area – Nova Scotia coast; no watch for South Carolina coast in current advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Surf City NC northward to NC/VA line; Tropical-Storm Warning VA coast to Cape Cod; none for South Carolina
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. coastline from northern Florida through North Carolina and onward toward New England and Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.wind: Peak tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 kt) affected the port area early on 5 Sep; hurricane-force winds remained offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Coastal surge of 3–5 ft occurred along the South Carolina coast as Dorian passed offshore, with locally higher water levels in inlets.
weather_observation.rainfall: Storm-total rainfall estimates of 6–10 inches along the South Carolina coast, including Charleston metro, produced flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large, dangerous surf and rip currents; brief tornado threat in rainbands on 5 Sep.
